channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: Theragun's pricey massage gun delivers on its muscle recovery promise
item.description: The Theragun Elite is a percussive therapy massage gun that helped my sore muscles recover from workouts and alleviate aches and pains.

item.title: The Morning After: LG quits the smartphone race
item.description: Today’s headlines: LG quits the smartphone race, scientists demonstrate how DNA can be collected from the air and Hyundai’s Genesis broke the world record for the most drones in the sky.

item.title: Federal labor agency says Amazon illegally fired climate activists
item.description: Amazon illegally retaliated against two former employees after it fired them for staging climate and workplace safety protests last year, according to federal labor regulators.

item.title: Samsung's Adidas-branded Galaxy Buds Pro come in a snapback-shaped case
item.description: Samsung is doing some co-branding with Adidas as a way to create some buzz around its wireless earbud products, while buffing up its eco-friendly bonafides.

item.title: LG confirms it's shutting down its mobile business
item.description: LG is shutting down its struggling mobile business after failing to reverse years of losses.

item.title: Genesis broke a world record for the most drones in the sky
item.description: Hyundai's Genesis brand just broke a world record for the most drones airborne at the same time, putting 3,281 UAVs in the air for a publicity stunt.

item.title: Scientists show you can collect DNA from the air
item.description: Scientists have shown that you can collect DNA from the air, opening new ways to study airborne diseases and investigate crimes.

item.title: NASA deploys Mars helicopter before its pioneering first flight
item.description: NASA's Perserverance rover has deployed the Ingenuity helicopter on Mars ahead of its historic first flight.

item.title: Extreme E's first race ends with a small amount of drama
item.description: The first Extreme E race has a winner after its share of excitement, marking a historic moment for electric off-road racing.

item.title: The latest Lego Star Wars game has been delayed indefinitely
item.description: 'Lego Star Wars: The Skywalker Saga' has been delayed indefinitely — the second time the game has been pushed back.

item.title: Learn to play the drums from home with this $170 virtual drum set
item.description: With the PocketDrum set, you can connect a pair of drumsticks and foot petals to a Bluetooth device and practice your craft on any surface you want.

item.title: GMC's newly-unveiled Hummer EV SUV is 830HP of electric 'supertruck'
item.description: The Hummer EV pickup won't be the only "supertruck" in GMC's fleet after the automaker unveiled its Hummer EV SUV variant on Saturday. It's slated for release in spring 2023.

item.title: Microsoft delays full reopening of its offices to at least September
item.description: Microsoft has delayed the full reopening of its offices until September 7th at the earliest as it comes to terms with the possible end of the pandemic.

item.title: You still can't buy the base OnePlus 9 Pro
item.description: OnePlus has delayed sales of the base 9 Pro, leaving customers no choice but to buy the higher-end model.

item.title: Amazon apologizes for tweets attacking criticism of working conditions
item.description: Amazon has apologized for tweets attacking Rep. Mark Pocan after he criticized the company's working conditions, including drivers who have to pee in bottles.

item.title: Personal data for 533 million Facebook users leaks on the web
item.description: A database of personal info for 533 million Facebook users has leaked on the web, including phone numbers.

item.title: Pornhub's first transparency report details how it addresses illegal content
item.description: Pornhub has published its first ever transparency report that sheds light on its content moderation practices and reports its received from January 2020 to December 2020.

item.title: 'Space Jam: A New Legacy' trailer pays tribute to sci-fi
item.description: The trailer for 'Space Jam: A New Legacy' has arrived, showing its sci-fi premise ahead of its July 16th debut on HBO Max.

item.title: Hitting the Books: The bias behind AI assistants' failure to understand accents
item.description: The age of speaking to our computers as we do with other humans is finally upon us. But as with other long-awaited technologies such as self-driving cars and computer vision systems, voice-activated assistants like Siri and Alexa aren't nearly as revolutionary as we'd hope.

item.title: These power and electrical engineering training courses are on sale for $40
item.description: With 32 hours of training on power and electrical engineering, this nine-course bundle will introduce you to fundamentals such as cooling and mechanical systems, MATLAB, inverters, DC choppers and much more.

item.title: The Morning After: Xbox mini-fridges are really happening
item.description: A real Xbox fridge might not be exactly like the one Microsoft gave Snoop Dogg, but we're going to find out.

item.title: Recommended Reading: NFTs before the hype took over
item.description: Recommended Reading highlights the week's best long-form writing on technology and more.

item.title: Extreme E's first qualifying round ends with Nico Rosberg's team out front
item.description: The off-road electric racing series started its first weekend with some big crashes, and Nico Rosberg's team in P1 after the first qualifying round.

item.title: Pinterest is reportedly in talks to acquire VSCO
item.description: NYT sources claim Pinterest and VSCO could team up.

item.title: A sealed copy of 'Super Mario Bros.' just sold for $660,000
item.description: The copy was one of the earliest shrink-wrapped versions of the games you could buy in the US.
